channel.title: Dark Souls or Skyrim?
channel.description: Wanna die or live a new life? What do you think about these two games with stunning game play? 3rd person and first person Dark Souls: [youtube]http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7pV5r4ePww8[/youtube] [youtube]http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=r3HdfzC7Shg[/youtube] Skyrim: [youtube]http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PjqsYzBrP-M[/youtube] [youtube]http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=w1AenlOEXao[/youtube]

item.title: Dark Souls or Skyrim?
item.dc:creator: @reyx7 reyx7
item.description:
@reyx7 wrote:

[quote=“Cole1497, post:34, topic:427432”][quote author=reyx7 link=topic=530127.msg3873028#msg3873028 date=1325478185]
(I get 37 damage per dagger)
[/quote]
I get 79 per daedric longsword
Your move[/quote]
Just realized I can get 50% bonus damage on the duel handed special attack, meaning I can hit 6660 in one hit, and if I can get that ring up to 13320 damage. From one attack.
And yea, I’m working on getting Daedric daggers, it’s just a pain in the ass because I’m also doing the dark brotherhood quests.

item.title: Dark Souls or Skyrim?
item.dc:creator: @Svitkona Svitkona
item.description:
@Svitkona wrote:

Well I’m not sure since I haven’t played skyrim yet, but in oblivion you were able to manipulate the leveling system to give you an advantage (it takes a lot of time though!). In morrowind you were even more free with the game and by the time you leveled high enough you were basically unstoppable. I’m not saying this is a bad thing, there’s a sense of accomplishment you get once you realise nothing can kill you in the whole game, but there’s also that sense of accomplishment you get when you beat a challenging game like Dark/Demon Souls.

PS the leveling system in oblivion/fallout new vegas was extremely retarded

Read full topic

item.title: Dark Souls or Skyrim?
item.dc:creator: @Team_Rocket Team_Rocket
item.description:
@Team_Rocket wrote:

[quote=“ox random xi, post:36, topic:427432”][quote author=Team_Rocket link=topic=530127.msg3873015#msg3873015 date=1325477786]

Dark Souls is better than Skyrim, if Skyrim had a set difficulty on Expert level, then Skyrim.

change the difficulty…

Dark souls is basically demon souls if you’ve played that. If you want a really challenging game go for dark souls. I haven’t played skyrim, but from what I’ve seen from morrowind and oblivion, once you level up enough you basically become a god.

called progression m8. And no, you only become a god to weaker npc’s, there are plenty of places that if you go there when youre a low level you will get wiped out.

All it does is make everything have more health.
[/quote]
I think if I recall, they took the Fallout approach with Skyrim, where different areas are different levels, unlike Oblivion where monsters would level with you (Did I get that messed up?)[/quote]

No, you got that right. It’s still too easy though. Fallout: New Vegas was like this, not Fallout: 3.

Read full topic

item.title: Dark Souls or Skyrim?
item.dc:creator: @Team_Rocket Team_Rocket
item.description:
@Team_Rocket wrote:

[quote=“Cole1497, post:34, topic:427432”][quote author=reyx7 link=topic=530127.msg3873028#msg3873028 date=1325478185]
(I get 37 damage per dagger)
[/quote]
I get 79 per daedric longsword
Your move[/quote]

You’ll want to use a Dagger eventually for your Rogue. Dagger in the main hand and a Mace in the off-hand makes a good combination in my opinion. Make sure if you use this that you put points into the Perk that allows maces to ignore a percentage of an enemies armor.

item.title: Dark Souls or Skyrim?
item.dc:creator: @reyx7 reyx7
item.description:
@reyx7 wrote:

Lvl 35 wood elf
85 smithing
91 sneak
67 pickpocketing
62 one handed
51 range

My main approach is duel ebony daggers (epic) (I get 37 damage per dagger), sneak behind an enemy and use the stamina draining double attack. My sneak gives a 15x damage multiplier, and the daggers hit about 8 times in the clusterfuck. So if you do the math, that’s 555 per hit, 4440 damage in total. I can bring down pretty much anything, from frost trolls to giants. I’m yet to sneak up on a dragon, but when I do, that fucker will die. I’ve also heard there is a ring or something that gives 2x to attacks done while sneaking, so that’d be a 30x damage bonus.

All in all, Skyrim is fucking awesome. And at the end of the day, when I’m done being a sneaky little fucker, I go to the bridge leading into solitude and use the first shout you get to blow everyone off.

Read full topic

item.title: Dark Souls or Skyrim?
item.dc:creator: @Cole1497 Cole1497
item.description:
@Cole1497 wrote:

Frell:

called progression m8. And no, you only become a god to weaker npc’s, there are plenty of places that if you go there when youre a low level you will get wiped out.

I second this. I have a 512 armor rating with one of the best weapons, and occasionally play on apprentice difficulty and will still die from harder enemies.
Oblivion is different though. Getting 100+ Acrobatics/Agility = unstoppable.

However, I’ve come across even more glitches with Skyrim (game breaking ones), hindering me from using Guardian Stones, finishing quests, and capturing dragon souls.
I still hold my vote for it though. Very fun.

Read full topic
